text:
I have directory structure:
chmod 755 /path/to/foo
chmod 755 /path/to/foo/errors
chmod 700 /path/to/foo/bar
in the /foo directory there is an htaccess file with the line:
403 /path/to/foo/errors/forbidden.html
the file forbidden is chmod 644.
http://www.test.com/foo correclty will display the custom 403.
http://www.test.com/foo/bar correclty will display the custom 403.
http://www.test.com/foo/bar/noFile.html does not display the custom 403 but the 
default 403. This should show the CUSTOM 403!
creator: rw263@nyu.edu

text:
This is, because the .htaccess will not be evaluated (processing stops in an
earlier stage), A drawback of htaccess files.
